KORE always try our best for your pleasant orbital flight. Hope to enjoy our products.

And feel free to tune them for yourself, and share them for others.

Have a nice flight!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T21:24:36Z" title="06/23/2015 09:24  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by stardog573**
  
update - new product
Wow, 40 tons to LKO with an SSTO, and it looks nice too! Great job and Rep for you, sir!
Nice work! Really like these ships, hope to expect more where that came from ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Are those drop tanks on the last one? I don't see them attached in the second picture, and if so then it's a spaceplane but not really an SSTO.

> 
> Are those drop tanks on the last one? I don't see them attached in the second picture, and if so then it's a spaceplane but not really an SSTO.

No, They're not drop tanks. As you can see in first picture in the right bottom, there is no stage except #0.

Hi all,

 I seem to be having a problem putting payloads in the cargo bays. I can't attach a docking port to the docking port in the bay.... It just jumps around and misaligns. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif):(

Any suggestions? Operator error is always of course actively assumed!....![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Hi all,
>  I seem to be having a problem putting payloads in the cargo bays. I can't attach a docking port to the docking port in the bay.... It just jumps around and misaligns. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif):(
> 
> Any suggestions? Operator error is always of course actively assumed!....![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Same problem I have, too. Have to detach cargo bay, attach cargo to docking port and re-attach cargo bay. 

![cw8hMjg.gifv](http://i.imgur.com/cw8hMjg.gifv)
Just added new product, hope you like it.

> 
> Just added new product, hope you like it.

I love it ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ! An 80km orbit is crazy enough, plus the reliable design of the KORE 402? Dude that is awesome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Rep man, Rep ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

Could you possibly try a Liquid Fuel only SSTO?
Thanks for rep. Liquid fuel only SSTO is possible with nukes, obviously. I think I saw one in the forum. I'll see if excluding oxidizer is beneficial enough.

> 
> So I made 402's fuel tanks with triangular configuration. Now centroid of triangle is aligned with cargo bay center. With this configuration, cockpit is pushed to front and balances with 4-engines at rear.

That phrase right there earns you some rep. Kudos for the intelligent design principle! I've been using it for a while now, but it's always nice to see I'm not the only one overthinking things. Oh, and nice birds too ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Rune. Playing with configurations to find balance is very rewarding when you manage to marry form and function.
Nice job on the triangular fuel loadout.
Thanks Rune, FleshJeb! Now I'm working on new model of Mk3 class, she's coming soon!

Wooah... KORE 202 man xD

Best thing about all of these, no com shift! And they really are sstos for every occasion! Bravo! And, dat ascent profile.. wow
